title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 181.1 - Findings and purpose
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 181.1 - Findings and purpose

State Regulations

The Department of Environmental Conservation hereby finds
that rabies in certain wildlife species exists in the State and threatens the
health and welfare of people and native animal populations. The virulent nature
of rabies requires prompt and extraordinary actions. The purpose of this Part
is to identify such actions with respect to taking, possession, transportation, sale or liberation of wildlife which may have been exposed to or contracted
rabies. All such actions are necessary in the public interest to prevent the
development, spread or further introduction of rabies. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
181.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
